Function_[CC]: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the formation of acetolactate from pyruvate, the first step in valine and isoleucine biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10386618, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16665813, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16667374, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16668488, ECO:0000269|PubMed:2336405, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8913312, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9355748, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9677339, ECO:0000269|Ref.9}.

Protein_names: Acetolactate synthase large subunit IlvB1 (ALS) (EC 2.2.1.6) (Acetohydroxy-acid synthase large subunit) (AHAS)
Taxonomic_lineage_ALL: cellular organisms, Bacteria, Terrabacteria group, Actinobacteria, Actinomycetia (high G+C Gram-positive bacteria), Corynebacteriales, Mycobacteriaceae, Mycobacterium, Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Mycobacterium tuberculosis (strain ATCC 25618 / H37Rv)
Catalytic_activity: CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Reaction=H(+) + 2 pyruvate = (2S)-2-acetolactate + CO2; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:25249, ChEBI:CHEBI:15361, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:16526, ChEBI:CHEBI:58476; EC=2.2.1.6; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
ChEBI: pyruvate [CHEBI:15361]; H(+) [CHEBI:15378]; Mg(2+) [CHEBI:18420]; thiamine diphosphate [CHEBI:58937]; (2S)-2-acetolactate [CHEBI:58476]; CO2 [CHEBI:16526]
ChEBI_IDs: CHEBI:15361; CHEBI:15378; CHEBI:18420; CHEBI:58937; CHEBI:58476; CHEBI:16526
Cofactor: COFACTOR: Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250};  Note=Binds 1 Mg(2+) ion per subunit. {ECO:0000250}; COFACTOR: Name=thiamine diphosphate; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:58937; Evidence={ECO:0000250};  Note=Binds 1 thiamine pyrophosphate per subunit. {ECO:0000250};
Function_[CC]: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the conversion of 2 pyruvate molecules into acetolactate in the first common step of the biosynthetic pathway of the branched-amino acids such as leucine, isoleucine, and valine. Also involved in condensing pyruvate and 2-ketobutyrate to form 2-aceto-2-hydroxybutyrate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690}.
Kinetics: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  Kinetic parameters: KM=2.76 mM for pyruvate (with the catalytic subunit alone at pH 7.5 and at 37 degrees Celsius) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690}; KM=1.56 mM for pyruvate (with the catalytic and regulatory subunits at pH 7.5 and at 37 degrees Celsius) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
Pathway: PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-isoleucine biosynthesis; L-isoleucine from 2-oxobutanoate: step 1/4.; PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-valine biosynthesis; L-valine from pyruvate: step 1/4.
Temperature_dependence: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  Temperature dependence: Optimum temperature is between 35 and 40 degrees Celsius. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
pH_dependence: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  pH dependence: Optimum pH is between 6 and 7. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
Features: Binding site (2); Chain (1); Metal binding (2); Nucleotide binding (2); Region (2)
Keywords: Amino-acid biosynthesis;Branched-chain amino acid biosynthesis;FAD;Flavoprotein;Magnesium;Metal-binding;Reference proteome;Thiamine pyrophosphate;Transferase
Subunit_structure_[CC]: SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of large catalytic subunit and small regulatory subunit. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16111681}.
Induction: INDUCTION: The expression is high during the mid-exponential phase and low during the stationary phase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690}.

Disruption_phenotype: DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Auxotrophic for all of the 3 branched-chain amino acids (isoleucine, leucine and valine), when grown with either C6 or C2 carbon sources. Depletion of these branched chain amino acids in the medium led to loss of viability. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19542000}.

Catalytic_activity: CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Reaction=H(+) + 2 pyruvate = (2S)-2-acetolactate + CO2; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:25249, ChEBI:CHEBI:15361, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:16526, ChEBI:CHEBI:58476; EC=2.2.1.6; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630};PhysiologicalDirection=left-to-right; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:25250; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630}; CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Reaction=2-oxobutanoate + H(+) + pyruvate = (S)-2-ethyl-2-hydroxy-3-oxobutanoate + CO2; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:27654, ChEBI:CHEBI:15361, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:16526, ChEBI:CHEBI:16763, ChEBI:CHEBI:49256; EC=2.2.1.6; Evidence={ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630};PhysiologicalDirection=left-to-right; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:27655; Evidence={ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630};
ChEBI: pyruvate [CHEBI:15361]; H(+) [CHEBI:15378]; Mg(2+) [CHEBI:18420]; (S)-2-ethyl-2-hydroxy-3-oxobutanoate [CHEBI:49256]; thiamine diphosphate [CHEBI:58937]; 2-oxobutanoate [CHEBI:16763]; (2S)-2-acetolactate [CHEBI:58476]; CO2 [CHEBI:16526]
ChEBI_IDs: CHEBI:15361; CHEBI:15378; CHEBI:18420; CHEBI:49256; CHEBI:58937; CHEBI:16763; CHEBI:58476; CHEBI:16526
Cofactor: COFACTOR: Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250};  Note=Binds 1 Mg(2+) ion per subunit. {ECO:0000250}; COFACTOR: Name=thiamine diphosphate; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:58937; Evidence={ECO:0000250};  Note=Binds 1 thiamine pyrophosphate per subunit. {ECO:0000250};
Function_[CC]: FUNCTION: Catalytic subunit of mitochondrial acetolactate synthase, which catalyzes the first of a series of common steps in the biosynthesis of the branched-chain amino acids. Catalyzes the irreversible decarboxylation of pyruvate to a bound hydroxyethyl group that then condenses with either a second pyruvate molecule to form 2-acetolactate (AL) or with 2-ketobutyrate to form 2-aceto-2-hydroxybutyrate (AHB). The first product is the precursor for valine and leucine biosynthesis, while the second leads to isoleucine. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630}.
Kinetics: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  Kinetic parameters: KM=8.6 mM for pyruvate (catalytic subunit only) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630}; KM=18.1 mM for pyruvate (reconstituted into the acetolactate synthase complex with the regulatory subunit) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630};
Pathway: PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-isoleucine biosynthesis; L-isoleucine from 2-oxobutanoate: step 1/4. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630}.; PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-valine biosynthesis; L-valine from pyruvate: step 1/4. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630}.
pH_dependence: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  pH dependence: Optimum pH is 7-7.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630};
Metal_binding: METAL 550;  /note="Magnesium"; METAL 577;  /note="Magnesium"; METAL 579;  /note="Magnesium; via carbonyl oxygen"
Features: Beta strand (26); Binding site (2); Chain (1); Helix (34); Metal binding (3); Nucleotide binding (2); Region (2); Transit peptide (1); Turn (3)
Miscellaneous_[CC]: MISCELLANEOUS: Contains 1 molecule of FAD per monomer. The role of this cofactor is not clear considering that the reaction does not involve redox chemistry.; MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 31900 molecules/cell in log phase SD medium. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14562106}.
Keywords: 3D-structure;Amino-acid biosynthesis;Branched-chain amino acid biosynthesis;Magnesium;Metal-binding;Mitochondrion;Reference proteome;Thiamine pyrophosphate;Transferase;Transit peptide
Subunit_structure_[CC]: SUBUNIT: Homodimer. The acetolactate synthase complex contains the catalytic subunit ILV2 and the regulatory small subunit ILV6. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630}.
